    URLs utilities.

    Osman KOCAK

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static URL create(String url)
        Creates a new URL by parsing the given String. This function invokes the URL.URL(java.lang.String) constructor; any MalformedURLException thrown by the constructor is caught and wrapped in a new IllegalArgumentException, which is then thrown. This method is provided for use in situations where it is known that the given String is a legal URL.
        Parameters:
        url - the String to be parsed into a URL.
        Returns:
        the created URL.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if url is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if url is not a valid URL.

      • relativize

        public static String relativize(URL base,
                                URL full)
        Relativizes the specified full URL against the given base. Behaves as URI.relativize(java.net.URI).
        Parameters:
        base - the base URL.
        full - the full URL.
        Returns:
        the relativized path.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the relativization fails.

      • resolve

        public static URL resolve(URL base,
                          String path)
        Resolves the specified path against the given base URL. Behaves as URI.resolve(java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        base - the base URL.
        path - the path to resolve.
        Returns:
        the resolved URL.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path can't be resolved.
